IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE, ON A NOT-FOR-PROFIT BASIS AND WITHOUT DISCRIMINATION, A FULL RANGE OF RESIDENTIAL LIVING AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES FOR OLDER ADULTS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE, ON A NOT-FOR-PROFIT BASIS AND WITHOUT DISCRIMINATION, A FULL RANGE OF RESIDENTIAL LIVING AND HEALTH CARE SERVICES FOR OLDER ADULTS BY PROMOTING AND IMPLEMENTING SYSTEMS THAT MAINTAIN AND SUPPORT EVERY INDIVIDUAL'S OPTIMAL INDEPENDENCE AND LIFE WISHES IN A SAFE, DIGNIFIED ATMOSPHERE CONDUCIVE TO QUALITY RETIREMENT, BY ASSURING KNOWLEDGEABLE AND CONSISTENT LEADERSHIP IN RETIREMENT LIVING, LONG-TERM CARE, HOME CARE AND SUPPORT SERVICES AND BY DEVELOPING INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES WHICH RESPOND TO THE CHANGING NEEDS OF ITS RESIDENTS AND CLIENTS AND THE SOCIETY IT SERVES.
IRS990.Description: Church Homes, Inc., Congregational is a not-for-profit corporation, which owns and operates retirement and health care facilities in Hartford, CT (Avery Heights), and Salisbury, CT (Noble Horizons). Avery Heights consists of 130 skilled nursing beds, 69 intermediate care beds, 14 accomodations in a home for the aged, 66 independent living cottages, and 137 independent living apartments. In addition, Avery Heights operates a home health agency and Betty Larus Adult Day Health Center. Noble Horizons consists of 61 skilled nursing beds, 30 intermediate care beds, 50 independent living cottages and 19 accomodations in a home for the aged.

OtherLiabilities.Description: DUE TO THIRD PARTY REIMBURSEMENT AG

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: INVESTMENT INCOME UTILIZED TO SUPPORT OPERATIONS AND ACQUISITIONS OF FIXED ASSETS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTERERST AGREEMENTS: -8536.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE IS OFFERED TO EMPLOYEES OR THEIR CHILDREN WHO WISH TO PURSUE PROFESSIONAL AND VOCATIONAL COURSES OF STUDY THAT ARE RELATED TO THE EMPLOYEE'S POTENTIAL FOR PROMOTION OR MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS. ALL COURSES MUST BE OFFERED THROUGH AN ACCREDITED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING OR BE APPROVED FOR CONTINUING EDUCATION UNITS. TO QUALIFY, THE EMPLOYEE MUST BE EMPLOYED 32 HOURS OR MORE AND HAVE COMPLETED ONE YEAR OF CONTINUOUS EMPLOYMENT. THE EMPLOYEE MUST HAVE A GOOD WORK ATTENDANCE RECORD. THE EMPLOYEE OR THEIR CHILD MUST MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE INSTITUTION OR AGENCY OFFERING THE COURSE. THE SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE IS AVAILABLE IF THE APPLICANT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR ASSISTANCE FROM OTHER SOURCES OF REIMBURSEMENT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED WITH THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AT REGULARLY SCHEDULED BOARD OF DIRECTOR MEETING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE PRESIDENT OF CHURCH HOMES, INC. REVIEWS THE RESPONSES TO THE ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE WITH THE COMMITTEE ON DIRECTORS. WHERE AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS, THE COMMITTEE ON DIRECTORS IS AUTHORIZED TO TAKE APPROPRIATE CORRECTIVE ACTION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CHURCH HOMES, INC. PERSONNEL COMMITTEE REVIEWS AND APPROVES OFFICER COMPENSATION ANNUALLY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
CHURCH HOMES NOTIFIED THE DONOR OF THE VALUE OF THE GOODS OR SERVICES PROVIDED UPON REQUEST.
